definition: the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
lamp/light/lantern/CL:盞|盏[zhan3]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
Diwali (Hindu festival)

sentences.english: People visit the Shwedagon Pagoda during the yellow robe weaving festival in Yangon, Burma (Myanmar).
sentences.chinese: 在缅甸传统的直桑岱点灯节，人们参观仰光大金塔。

sentences.english: Traffic jam caused by the celebration of the Diwali in North India
sentences.chinese: 北印度排灯节节庆所致的交通堵塞。

sentences.english: Many boys explode firecrackers on the Lantern Festival everyyear。
sentences.chinese: 许多男孩子每年在灯节放鞭炮。

sentences.english: The Festival of Light, Diwali to the indigenous people, marks the commencement of the New Year for Hindus.
sentences.chinese: 对印度教徒来说，排灯节标志着新年的来临。

sentences.english: During the Lantern Festival, people hang up colourful lanterns in their courtyards, play Yangko and set off fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 灯节时，人们在庭院里悬挂彩灯，扭秧歌并燃放烟花。

sentences.english: Today is the Lantern Festival, why not go to wach the Dragon Dances with us?
sentences.chinese: 今天是灯节，为什么不跟我们去看舞龙呢？

sentences.english: It is the first time a private company has run the ice festival.
sentences.chinese: 这是首次由私人公司操办冰灯节。

sentences.english: Lydia:Thailand's Loi Krathong Festival is very beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 告诉你，泰国的水灯节真是太美了。

sentences.english: Many boys explode firecrackers on the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 许少女孩正在元霄灯节焚搁鞭炮。

sentences.english: In the North, as traditional customs combined with modern science and technology, there evolved the Ice Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在北方，传统习俗与现代科技相结合发展成为冰灯节。

sentences.english: Diwali is celebrated with fervor and gaiety .
sentences.chinese: 排灯节是一个充满热情与欢乐的节日。

sentences.english: Mongolian says "Ming dry zhuo pull", meaning thousand lamp that Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 蒙语称“明干卓拉”，意即千盏灯节。

sentences.english: The first Ice lanterns were a win-time tradition in northeast China .
sentences.chinese: 第一次冰灯节来源于中国东北的一个传统。

sentences.english: The origins of Thailand's Loi Krathong Festival are untraceable.
sentences.chinese: 泰国的水灯节正确来由已经不可考了。

sentences.english: Eric:So what's so special about the Loi Krathong Festival?
sentences.chinese: 那水灯节有什么特别的呢？

definition: Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
Ghost Festival on 15th day of 7th lunar month when offerings are made to the deceased
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
see 端午節|端午节[Duan1 wu3 jie2]
Birthday of the Flowers, spring festival on lunar 12th or 15th February
temple fair
festival
Dragon Boat Festival (the 5th day of the 5th lunar month)
the New Year festival
holiday/festival/CL:個|个[ge4]
Torch Festival
New Year's Day in the lunar calendar
Songkran (Thai New Year)
to perform a lion dance
